channel.title: Comments on: (part 6 of 7) A Critical Review of â€œHe Died for Me”

item.title: By: Rexford Semrad
item.dc:creator: Rexford Semrad
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/a-critical-review-of-he-died-for-me-limited-atonement-the-universal-gospel-part-6-of-7/#comment-467">Jim Handyside</a>.
I don't know that there is any settled agreement as to what defines a high-Calvinist or moderate-Calvinist. High-Calvinism is usually associated with supralapsarianism, so since I am an infralapsarian, I don't think I necessarily fit into the category. However, Johnson considers Owen and Turretin to be primary representatives of high-Calvinism, in which case I would definitely fit into the category. Still others might set the border between high and moderate Calvinism at the point of the well-meant offer of the gospel, in which case I'm considered moderate since I staunchly defend it.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jim Handyside.

I don’t know that there is any settled agreement as to what defines a high-Calvinist or moderate-Calvinist. High-Calvinism is usually associated with supralapsarianism, so since I am an infralapsarian, I don’t think I necessarily fit into the category. However, Johnson considers Owen and Turretin to be primary representatives of high-Calvinism, in which case I would definitely fit into the category. Still others might set the border between high and moderate Calvinism at the point of the well-meant offer of the gospel, in which case I’m considered moderate since I staunchly defend it.

item.title: By: Jim Handyside
item.dc:creator: Jim Handyside
item.description: Thank you for this review, it has been very helpful. If I agree with you (which I do), would I be classified as a "high Calvinist"? Just wondering what label would identify my view.
item.content:encoded: Thank you for this review, it has been very helpful. If I agree with you (which I do), would I be classified as a “high Calvinist”? Just wondering what label would identify my view.
